posters.title: Edge AI for Robotics
posters.abstract: This poster presents a novel approach to deploying AI models on edge devices for robotic applications. We demonstrate real-time object detection and path planning on resource-constrained hardware.

faq.question: What hardware platforms did you test on?
faq.answer: We tested on Raspberry Pi 4, NVIDIA Jetson Nano, and Google Coral Dev Board.

faq.question: What are the typical inference times?
faq.answer: Object detection runs at 30 FPS on Jetson Nano and 15 FPS on Raspberry Pi 4.

faq.question: Is the code open source?
faq.answer: Yes, our implementation is available on GitHub under MIT license.

posters.title: Secure Multi-Party Computation
posters.abstract: We introduce a new protocol for secure multi-party computation that enables collaborative data analysis while preserving privacy. Our method achieves 40% better performance than existing approaches.

faq.question: What cryptographic primitives do you use?
faq.answer: Our protocol is based on garbled circuits and oblivious transfer with optimizations for specific use cases.

faq.question: How many parties can participate?
faq.answer: Our current implementation supports 2-10 parties, with plans to scale to larger groups.

posters.title: 5G Network Slicing for IoT
posters.abstract: This work explores network slicing techniques in 5G networks optimized for IoT deployments. We present a dynamic resource allocation algorithm that improves latency by 60%.

faq.question: What IoT use cases did you test?
faq.answer: We tested with smart city sensors, industrial IoT, and connected vehicle scenarios.

posters.title: Explainable AI in Healthcare
posters.abstract: We developed an explainable AI framework for medical diagnosis that provides interpretable insights to clinicians. Our system has been validated on real patient data with 95% accuracy.

posters.title: Autonomous Drone Navigation
posters.abstract: This poster showcases our autonomous navigation system for drones in GPS-denied environments. Using visual-inertial odometry and SLAM, drones can navigate complex indoor spaces.
